THE ORIGIN AND SITUATION OF A COLONY OF ABIPONES NAMED FROM S. CARLOS AND THE ROSARY.

Weary of Christian discipline, and of the inactivity of peace, they for some time vexed the territories of the Spa- niards and Guaranies with slaughter and rapine: but seeing themselves threatened, both behind and before, with avenging arms, and being un- able to discover any place of retreat where they might conceal themselves from Ychoalay‚ they provided sor their safety by artifice, since they could not secure it by force of arms. Three orators were sent to Asumpcion to petition‚ in the name of the rest, for a colony, and priests to instruct them in religion.
